The quiche was good, I really liked the benedict though. The benedict actually is predominant in my mind more than my quiche. Anyways. If you want to know if i'd be back.. definitely would be. Its a cute place to go grab a coffee, and have breakfast/brunch with a SMALL group of friends.   It's worth waiting for, and if you can't wait order to go. Problem solved :)

This small, quaint and spectacular cafe is literally right across the street from us.  All it took was that first visit for it to become one of our faves and Sunday morning rituals.  Atmosphere and decor is very small and cozy, resembling a cafe or B&B in New England along Cape Cod or Nantucket.  Everything we have chosen from the menu is delicious, reminding us of our roots back east of comfort food with a gourmet twist.  If you like eggs benedict you have to try it.  The tarragon biscut and hollondaise makes it the best we've ever had!  The mocha latte is also divine with a good whollop of homemade whipped cream for a topper!

Cute cafe, pretty small, 4 or so tables inside and a few outside on patio. I'm a huge eggs Benedict fan, they serve it on a muffin (not English muffin) which was a little weird. The egg, ham, and Hollandaise was yummy though. I would go back, but wouldn't order the eggs Benedict.

We appeared after hiking nearby.  A very small eatery which seems to have catering as its mainstay biz.  Fast & friendly order taking; we waited outside for Arizona & Florence benedicts to arrive.  Fresh poached/basted eggs, yum seasonings and biscuits.  We will return!

Nice folks but too small and most importantly the food was eh. Super salty biscuit on the benedict with cold potatoes. Also you get charged for coffee refills so make sure you don't get another cup at $2 a pop!

This is the kind of place that exists because people like us support local businesses.   I was driving along looking for a different restaurant for breakfast when I spotted Benedict's at the intersection. My brain and stomach decided this was the spot. And once again, my instincts were correct.   This place has been around for 10 years or so in the catering realm and only a few years with the little storefront restaurant. They make everything from scratch. And while they have a very limited breakfast menu (homemade quiche, omelets, croissant sandwich, oatmeal and one or two other things) I can only tell you that the coffee cake is very good warm and the croissant sandwich rocks.   I happened to roll in when they were baking some fresh croissants. So when I learned that, I decided to wait the 15 minutes for the croissant. I sipped on some wonderful Mexican coffee that I wanted to swim in it was so good.   Finally, the sandwich was ready. Two fluffy, scrambled eggs, chefs, roasted tomato, bacon (which I had the first day and sausage the second day) and home made pesto sauce. Outstandingly crunch, fluffy and tastilicious that I honestly did not want the sandwich eating to end. But it did. And you better believe I scraped up every little bit of flaky croissant goodness that was left on the plate.   Once again, this is a place that I will return to when I come back to Phoenix next year for my week or so of work.   And if you are a local in Phoenix, get these guys to cater your affair. You'd be a superstar.

Wow!  Amazing hidden gem!! French everything!  Service was excellent and food was out of this world!! We went there for a quick breakfast and we couldn't believe how delicious the food was!!  I ordered the croissant breakfast sandwich and the croissant was so flakey!! My brother ordered the eggs benedict with chorizo and corn bread and he was in love with it!!
The service was splendid, but my toast was slightly burnt. However I did like the crepe it was a winner. Ciao!

I have wanted to try this place for a very long time. With only weekend hours available it's been very hard for me to make it. But on this Sunday, I had some free time and pulled up my bookmarks looking for a good breakfast place.    I am glad I tried it. I ordered pancakes, which is my go to breakfast. But at the last minute I decided to also get an omelette BLT. Be able to use one of my favorite sandwiches but most the time it's just plain bread/bacon, and not worth it.   In this case it was absolutely worth it! The BLT it was simply delicious. I am very glad I ordered it and will come back again just for the sandwich.   All in all a great experience and I would recommend this place; it's a cute shop with a warm atmosphere. The staff was a little disoriented and the service was slow but everyone was very friendly and welcoming.

Quaint little French cafe with indoor and and outdoor cafe eating, you feel like you are in Paris. Kelsey was our server, she was darling. Hubby and I both ordered eggs benedict, hince the name, it was really delicious. Will definitely come back

Great California Benedict and great service plus good coffee!   We also tried 3 desserts which were amazing...yes 3 don't judge me...lol...chocolate chip cookie/bread pudding/sour cream cake...all good  We will definitely come back. It's in a gas station plaza but don't be fooled it's homemade goodness.

My husband and I were looking for a decent new breakfast place to try in the area. Naturally, we took to yelp! Benedict's had great reviews and we thought to give them a try. We were not disappointed! We were surprised to see how small the establishment was when there was nearly 200 reviews so far. When you walk in, there are a few tall bar-like tables on one side and a few bistro-like tables on the other with an order counter in the center. They also have a few patio seating tables outside in the shade. After taking a look at their simplistic menu, we placed our order. My husband, a food fanatic and self proclaimed critic (lol), ordered the classic Benedict and I had Challa French toast and green tea. Our food came out as quick as one would normally expect. There were two other parties there at the time. The flavor and quality of the food was fantastic! Even though the portions didn't seem large, we both got full. The French toast was easily one of the best I've ever had. My husband said his Benedict was very well prepared and the hollandaise was excellent.  The only reason I'm not choosing to give this review 5 stars is due to the size of the cafe and their seating. The inside dining area is about the size of large master bedroom with seating for about 16 people which would feel rather cramped if every table was full. The tables have barely enough space for two plates and drinks unless it is nice enough to sit outside.   However, the atmosphere and music was very quaint and cozy. It gave the feel as if you were in a small town at a cute little family owned cafe. Aside from an excellent breakfast menu they offer coffees, teas, and an assortment of pastries. And they cater! A great place for a cute, quiet breakfast or to chat with a friend over coffee and scones.

Good food, nice place, extremely small!  The food was terrific and home-made & just-made, but with enough of a twist in recipes and presentation that you it's worth it.  The coffee is relish, too. Heading to use the restroom will take you through the kitchen and that was immaculately clean.

Pluses:  good egg Benedicts, though one was overcooked so the poached egg was dry, and the tarragon biscuit was over salted.  Minuses:  the croissant egg sandwich was cold...appeared to have been the first of four dishes cooked and then left standing to cool off.  More important, the service was terrible.  We ordered a large coffee and cocoa when we first arrived, on a quiet Sunday morning with only a couple tables occupied, and it didn't arrive even 20 minutes later, after our food had been served.  When we complained, after a few minutes the waitress (an older gray haired woman, not sure if it was the owner, since she had a bit of an attitude), came back and asked us to remind her if we had ordered a large or small coffee.  We told her we had ordered (and prepaid for) a large.  Some minutes later still, the younger waitress came by with a SMALL coffee.   Then, after we cancelled the coffee and the cocoa, since we had already eaten our meal, and still had not received either of the drinks we hard ordered a half hour earlier, we didn't get a receipt for the credit.  When I went up to the counter to ask for the receipt, the younger waitress (dark hair) said she didn't know how to print one out on their system.  I had to show her how myself...even though it was very obvious from the payment system they were using (Square).  Bottom line:  forgetful and incompetent service.

This was a little place, much smaller than expected. Luckily, we went when it was not busy at all. We had trouble choosing what to eat for breakfast, we ended up splitting three entrees so we could taste all three. They were all good. We even took some desserts to go when we left. It is more expensive than I would spend for breakfast everyday but I definitely want to go back for brunch sometime.

Tiny in size but big on quality. We really enjoy Benedict's (my wife and I) and like the small, cozy space.  It's so much better than the breakfast factories around us. Of course, order any of the benedicts, they are fabulous.

To sum up Benedict's in a word: limited. The menu. The seating. The portions. The pre-mixed breakfast burrito filling that can't be altered to order. The irony that eggs benedict isn't on the weekday menu. Because of this I'm limiting Benedict's to a single star.  Response to Owner: Here's the rub Dawn. During my experience at Benedict's I asked that my burrito come sans onions and the response from an employee was "I'm sorry, we're not able to do that". So either your employees are misinformed, I was lied to, or you're calling me a liar. I'd love to know which one Dawn. At any rate, I'm sure your cafe does fine in Scottsdale, but living here in the Choice City we simply have different standards. Thanks for the shamelessly self promoting comment anyway. All the best.

When you find a hidden gem like this, it's hard to want to tell anyone else about it because you want all the deliciousness to yourself! But after coming here for a few months now, I wanted to give them a top notch review for their awesome customer service and warm atmosphere.  The dining space is small, so prepare to either squeeze inside or sit outside. I like the fact that it's intimate although if they are able to expand their space, that would be a smart move on their part.  The best part of this place for me is their coffee. They get it locally roasted from Passport Coffee in Scottsdale and it is some of the best coffee I've ever had! Mexicana roast...so freakin delicious! You'll just have to try it for yourself to see what I mean. It makes other coffee taste bad it's that amazing!  The food is also pretty good, I've had their croissant sandwich, challah sandwich, parfait, and oatmeal. The pesto they use on the sandwiches is top notch and adds a great flavor boost. I'd stay away from their side order of potatoes, however, because they often taste like they were cooked several hours ago and come out lukewarm and mushy (and not in a good way). That's the only thing I've eaten here that I don't thoroughly enjoy.  Overall, I keep coming back here for the delicious breakfast sandwiches, great customer service, and amazing coffee, and despite the cramped dining area and lackluster potato game, I still give this a full five star rating. Benedict's rocks!

My husband and I visit Benedict's every weekend for their delicious breakfast. Their breakfast burritos and crepes are our two favorite dishes. Their baked goods are AMAZING as well! Their coconut macaroons are my new favorite dessert item. On top of their great food, they have fabulous service as well. Dawn is always welcoming and Karen is always sweet and thoughtful. This is a great place to go for a weekend food outing.
Had the frittata special for breakfast today with a side of potatoes. Delicious!!! My favorite post-bike ride breakfast spot.
This little cafe type place was the perfect breakfast spot! The food is delicious! I got the oatmeal and side potatoes. So yummy!! I will for sure be coming back!

Always a great place to go and get brunch. It's a little far from my house but whenever I go hiking with my friends this is a usual place for us to end up. I always go for the eggs Benedict with the smoked salmon. I absolutely LOVE it. My friends have gotten the omelets and the challah French toast which are both delicious as well. They also have a Yelp deal which is great. The portions are huge and I always leave completely stuffed and just want to go home and sit on my couch. The girls who have taken our order are also sweet as well.   My only complaint is that the seating is super super limited. I think that there are 4 or 5 inside tables so if there are a lot of people there it's hard to find a seat and I always feel awkward hovering over other people as they eat. They have a couple tables outside but with the colder weather we have had it not always enjoyable to sit out there.  That is the only reason I would take a star off. Hopefully at so  point they can move into a larger location and this won't be an issue.
Very small but the food is good and I love the coffee they use

Great local diner, Great service. Food came out fast even though the place was packed. Dining area was tight. Reminded me of the cruise. But the good news is that I loved my cruise. neighborhood hang out and tourist, this is a great place for breakfast.

Who let this fantastic local business into Chainland?  Honestly, I think the City of Phoenix zoning commission must've mistakenly thought Benedict's Cafe was going into CenPho when they approved their app; not Reach 11-ish.  Don't let the exterior fool you - walk inside that tiny space in the strip center anchored by Circle K and you'll immediately be transported to someplace altogether different.  So far we've tried the salads and sandwiches (tuna and chicken curry), and all have been better than excellent and made with the freshest of ingredients.  We usually get takeout, but they also have a couple of tables where we've seen people being served.  Staff looks to be all family, and are so friendly and helpful.  An update is in order here, though, because I have to try their breakfast.  They serve eggs benedict and crepes on Saturday and Sunday, and they look amazing.  Benedict's is a perfect lunch spot.  I'm saving that 5th star for what looks like will be an excellent breakfast too.
Quite yummy. Nice small place to have some breakfast.

Meh, was ok.  My h ordered the Arizona Benedict there was only meat on half..I don't know why.  I had the burrito and it was good but they only give you about a tablespoon of salsa.  Iced coffee was really good.  My h got really sick after we ate here...not sure if it was due to his meal but, we probably won't go back just in case unless it's for beverage or pastry because those looked delicious!

Wanted to try a new little "local business" breakfast place on the way to Barrett Jackson.  Found this on Yelp.  The location is tucked away in a business park - but what a fantastic find! The food was amazing.  They were happy to accommodate 'sauce on the side' and 'dry toast' etc.  Lots of water and juice/coffee refills.  Menu isn't huge but everything was extremely FLAVORFUL.  Would definitely return.  Our waitress "Kaylee" (sp??) was delightful.  Super friendly.  Busy - definitely a  local spot - but we were treated just as well as the "familiars" - would ABSOLUTELY return to support this small business over the large chain breakfast joints.  Great Job guys!

I'm not sure what the hype here is about.. The decor is cute but small...I  think going when it was only 50 degrees outside didn't help my experience- the place is very small and no table escapes the breeze when the door opens...Its not clear when you walk in if they will take your order but after sitting for 5 minutes it was apparent that we needed to order at the counter...If you are a coffee person like I am, this isn't the place for that - milk options are whole milk or almond milk- nothing else- and though they have white peppermint mocha listed on their large specialty board, they were out- which was a disappointment for my husband. I ordered the berry crepes which were ok- the crepe itself was cold- and I mean refrigerated cold- so I'm not sure if they buy them pre-made or if they make ahead and store in the refrigerator- but either way, a little disappointed that they weren't made fresh to order...Winter isn't berry season so the blueberries were hard and tasteless-I did however, like the cream they were in- It is a whipped cream- not a vanilla custard cream you may find in other crepes. My husband had a Lox Benedict that he said was just ok...I'm not sure we would return- it's just ok and nothing special...I don't even think there's a restroom it's so small

I stumbled upon this place while checking my maps for a close place to get breakfast and boy I am glad! It is pretty small, I think it only has 4 tables. And it is only open weekends which is unfortunate because the food was really good. I tried the florentine benedict and it was amazing! The hollandaise was silky. I will definitely be back and would recommend it.

My first time visit. Very disappointed by the service and the food. I considered the yelp reviews and then decided to visit this place. It's overrated. I like how small and cute cafe it is but definitely not the food. Over priced and not worth it.  I ordered just a plain omelette and coffee. I've never had such an omelette,  so soggy and looked like uncooked. Potatoes too oily and burnt. I tried telling the server that omlette is uncooked and i can't eat. Didn't seem to work. I left the entire thing and walked out of the place. Not gonna visit again ! Paid for the food ,  yet left me starving.

Left the movies and was hungry, looked for somewhere nearby new via Yelp so I stopped by Benedict's .  Small cafe and catering shop.  Inside seats maybe 12 people,  outside seats about another 10-12. Ordered the #1 which was their Eggs Benedict and since I checked in on Yelp I received a free Ice Tea.  It was fresh brewed so I did have to ask for more ice as when it was served there was very little ice left in the take-a-way plastic cup.   My Benedict was good.  I've only had them once before at St Francis in Phx.  These came served over a nicely crunchy tarragon biscuit and I chose potatoes as a side.   I think this style of potatoes is known as home fries? Or country potatoes.  Overall I enjoyed my dish.  I don't live anywhere near here so it'll probably just be a one time stop.  But If I ever am in this area again I may pop in.
Nice little breakfast place. Very small though (I think they do most of their work catering). I had the breakfast burrito and a cinnamon roll with coffee and it satisfied. The service was excellent.

After walking in, I wanted to be able to give more than 3 stars, I really did - it's a cute, clean but TINY place that completely belies the strip mall location.  The good: My fresh berry crepes were wonderful!  Two crepes, stuffed full and topped with a night light crème fraîche - and the berries truly were fresh - delectable!  My wife enjoyed the pancakes, though they were not especially notable beyond that - good size, and done as expected.  The cramped: I did mention this place was tiny, right?  Yeah, we were squeezed in to a table next to a hutch that had the silent radio and cookbooks and a little display.  The radio was turned on a little after we got there, which did warm up the place a bit, but couldn't cover that we were literally twisting to stay in our seats and not bump our neighbors while eating.  It will likely get better if they can get a couple tables outside as the temps drop, but for now, I'll skip if there's not elbow room.  The place does have some charm, and I'll be back to see how it matures, and to try the eponymous dish.

its a conditional 4, the breakfast burrito was good (recommended 4/5), not huge -- the coffee was good -- egg sandwich was 3/5. its a small store front  located in a small shopping center with a gas station on the corner, and they have 3 small outside tables and 3ish inside

I had lunch with a friend at Benedict's Cafe today and was very impressed. Right away when you walk in, it feels homey and welcoming. I had the tuna salad and a peach mango tea - both were incredible. I'd highly recommend this little gem! And they cater, too.... I'll definitely be keeping them in mind for any events I may have in the future!

Really sweet little cafe with a delightful and interesting menu. I tried the croque monsieur, and the apples and fig jam really made it sing.  My husband ordered the Florentine Benedict and really enjoyed it, especially the tarragon biscuit which was nice and flaky. The fresh fruit was indeed fresh, and included a variety of berries which was nice. We liked their coffee as well, a pleasant meal all around.

Charming little place in a Circle K parking lot but don't let that fool you. Crepes and Benedict were delicious. However, there is really no room to eat but outside, and it will be way too hot for that very soon.

North Scottsdale is not a place known for its unique cafes and sense of community. In a city where big chain restaurants dominate the dining scene with mediocre food and impersonal service, small cafes like Benedict's are all-too-often overlooked. Other reviews have said it before, and I'll reiterate it: Benedict's is the absolute epitome of a diamond in the rough.  I saw Benedict's listed on Yelp as being a cafe where I could grab brunch and coffee on my free weekend days. My first impression was that it was really small and personal, which I liked. It was tucked away next to a gas station in a rather cheap-looking row of shops with royal blue awnings. The first time I went there, I kept it simple: breakfast burrito with bacon and a french roast coffee. The eggs were freshly scrambled, the bacon was crisp and flavorful, and the coffee was freshly brewed and a perfect temperature.  I've been back several times since, over the weekends and have tried their three cheese & herb omelet and the croissant sandwich, both of which were really good and really flavorful.  The staff is what really makes this place worthy of 5 stars in my eyes. Every time I've been back, I swear they've gotten friendlier. It's one of those places where, if you go in more than twice, they'll recognize you. I haven't met the owner yet, but I've chatted with a couple of their other employees (I believe their names were Barbara and Callie) and every time, I am greeted like family. They go out of their way to make conversation and make you feel at home. I'm a fairly shy guy and when I go to Benedict's, I feel a little less shy because of how friendly everyone is there. When I go into Benedict's after not going in for a couple weeks, they've told me (on several occasions), "we haven't seen you in a while!" That, my friends, is what great service looks like.  I hope that Benedict's can prosper and grow in a corporatized city like North Scottsdale. I hope that more folks in the Scottsdale area will give Benedict's a chance. It's a great little cafe and I will continue going back, as long as I live here.

I had the California Benedict and it was cold, without flavor.. The roasted potatoes were so salty, almost impossible to eat. The blueberry muffins looked amazing but tasting them was another experience :( not what I was expecting. The place looks good , the ambience is nice too. But the food, I'll pass.

Perfect breakfast/brunch spot! I went there with my boyfriend and he had the chorizo scramble and it was delicious! But the star of the show was my basil pesto breakfast croissant sandwich...out of this world with flavor! The pesto and parmesan took it to another level. I will definitely be going back!   Ps- The peach green tea is superb!

Since we are new to the Phoenix area, we have been exploring. New restaurants. We decided to give Benedict's a try.    The food for me was great.  I had the chorizo scramble which was very good  My wife had a croissant sandwich which pretty much fell apart on her upon her first bite.  It tasted good but was too messy for her tastes  The cafe is VERY intimate.  I did not mind it but my wife was a bit uncomfortable.  Prices were comparable to the area and the service was good.

Mothers Day 2015 was definitely not up to expectations.  Visited on a quiet Saturday noontime and enjoyed a wonderful breakfast. We returned on a Sunday a couple of weeks thereafter and although it was busy, we found a table in this small 15 seat space.  Our orders were delayed, the staff messed our drink order up, and we were not served our drinks until we asked for them, 20 minutes after we ordered them.   The owner offered no acknowledgement until we asked for our order, even avoided eye contact.  NOT the way to go for a small family business.   The quality of goods is superb, but they are clearly ill equipped to handle a busy spurt.   I will return, but not during a busy time.

Walked for the 1st time and the crew were smiling and so friendly. We ordered and sat down. The customers were lined up to Oder their favorites. Most knew what they wanted.  Pastries made there fresh. They looked "delish" Our breakfast food was so good.  Little place. A great hideaway. Open only weekends.

I never would have expected this place to be as good as it was. As a visiting Yelper from Kansas City, I rely on my brethren to suggest good food, drink, and entertainment. This recommendation was by far one of the best I've ever experienced.   Staying nearby and not wanting hotel food for breakfast, we ventured out looking for a solid meal for us and our little one. I'm so glad we stumbled upon Benedict's, a hole in the wall on Bell Rd that looks like it might have once housed a dry cleaners. Menu items were limited but all sounded terrific. I settled on the breakfast burrito, a regular benedict for my wife, and a pastry for our son.  I had some serious food envy of my wife's plate, a perfect concoction of eggs and hollandaise resting peacefully on top of a flaky biscuit. My regular coffee was "meh" but the Mexican coffee was excellent. The atmosphere was totally chill and things really starting picking up as we ate. Servers were attentive and very friendly.   We did notice another table missing some food items after they ordered and another table loudly cursing up a storm behind us. These don't detract from my review, but were noticeable enough to make things interesting.   We'll definitely return when back in Scottsdale. If you blink you might miss this gem. It was well worth taking a chance on a sunny Saturday morning.

Sunday 11/15/2015 I was treating a friend to brunch at Benedict's a quaint cozy place and I have to say it was horrifying. I was so embarrassed! I was speechless. We ordered the California Benedict and the Quiche. The food was cold. The ham and tomatoes seemed to be almost frozen. The avocado was brown and cold - nothing seem fresh. My girlfriend was sweet enough to say it's ok. I just couldn't eat or even think of serving food like this. I told her Benedict's carters and their food is normally fresh. I'm shocked that Benedict's has received great reviews in the past. I told one of the employees the food was cold - if they freeze it - then bake it - answer No. I decided to just try the veggie omelet with ham and my girlfriend ordered the french toast. It was awful! the eggs were way over cooked and brown. The cook forgot the ham - veggies well it was only mushrooms, a couple of zucchinis. Did I mention all the mushrooms and zucchinis were charcol burned! The french toast came out way after I was done eating. I wanted to buy Mexican coffee grinds (bag) to go but they were completely out. I ordered the chocolate croissants but they were out. I didn't really have a choice of desserts since they were out. The manager at Benedict's that Sunday was not doing a very good job of running the place. They need to hire cooks, chefs, be organized, stay stocked up, and be better prepared to be open to the public.

Usually I would just drive on by since it's hidden in a strip mall with a gas station and a dry cleaner but oh I'm so happy we didn't. The menu keeps to the basics - a few benedict's, omelets and of course a breakfast burrito and in keeping it short they really do a delicious job on what they focus on. I love the cheese and herb omelet. The potatoes are well spiced. The nice thing about this place is portions are small so you don't leave breakfast hating yourself for the rest of the day.   Only drawback- there's only ~5 inside tables  but if you find yourself waiting, it'll be worth it.

We were in town for a wedding and wanted to find a small place to visit and eat some amazing food.  We found Benedict's through a Yelp search.  The iced coffee is good.  The breakfast potatoes were A-mazing! We both ordered the lox Benedict.  Absolutely yummy in my tummy.  The service was great.  The bakery chef came out and offered us samples.  Everything tastes great and they are so nice here.  They also offer cooking classes.  There are only about four to five tables, so be sure to go early or call them for availability.  I do believe they mainly focus on catering.

3.5 stars.  Took advantage of yelp deals.  Solid and quick, smallish breakfast cafe. Friendly staff and great service.  Outdoor seating, tho in a strip mall parking lot (this might be standard in Scottsdale, not sure).  My group loved the cheesy omelet and the California benedict, and also enjoyed the eggs and lox and the croissant sandwich.  I noticed that many of the egg dishes were served on a very basic, average sourdough bread.  With a bakery/kitchen in back, why not serve them on croissants or biscuits?

Rarely do I find the inspiration to write a review but this place definitely inspired me. I typically don't expect a lot of flavor from most breakfast places - it's usually filling and not much in taste. We had the Benedict's Benedict and the French toast. The Benedict was served on a biscuit instead of muffin which was different but excellent. The french toast was excellent as well and the country potatoes which I'm almost never a fan of where spicy and full of taste. This is a true gem in the -254 despite its modest strip mall appearance.

Just had the eggs benedict and a veggie omelet. Eggs benedict had absolutely no flavor, the muffin it was on was hard as a rock. The potatoes were old and cold. The omelet was for a two year old.  We're  headed home now to make something to eat. Wish we'd done that in the first place.
I look forward to weekends and Benedicts, everything on the menu is amazing! Don't even get me started on the Mexican coffee, can't find better coffee in the valley!

I went to Benedict's Cafe today with a friend when we were in search of a good place for brunch in North Phoenix. After seeing the latest article in Phoenix Magazine where it was mentioned as one of the top 369 delicious meals under $10 we thought we'd check it out.   The place is super small in a CircleK strip mall. Really only seats 10 people inside. You have to order at a counter.   Naturally, after reading the article we both ordered the weekend special - eggs Benedict on a tarragon biscuit with country potatoes.   Shortly after we sat down the girl from the counter said they ran out of potatoes that were supposed to come with our dish. So, we each got a small side of fruit salad and 1 order of sourdough toast instead. One other guy at the next table had to select a different side too.   But we were still optimistic the eggs Benedict would be good.  However, we were pretty disappointed. Although it was an edible dish it wouldn't bring either of us back. The eggs were over cooked, the hollandaise sauce was far too lemony and the tarragon biscuits, although very flavorful, were very hard and dry- especially around the edges.   I ate all of mine (because I was starving) but my friend (whose eggs were cooked even more than mine) complained and they attempted to fix them. Instead of re-doing the presentation, they just re-did one of the eggs - which of course now was slightly undercooked with runny translucent egg white.   So, sad to say i don't think I will be back. But hopefully they can step things up after the Phoenix Magazine article!

Stayed at the JW Marriott a few miles away and came ere for my birthday breakfast. Food was amazing. I ordered the AZ bene and the BF got the berry crepes. So good and so fresh. The bene had a delicious chorizo patty, corn cake and avocado cream sauce.  I wish we lived closer so we could go there more often. Highly recommended.  It is in a strip mall, small store front and limited seating, but we went around 10:30 on a Saturday and there was no wait. We'll definitely be back!!

Being a yelper.. I found this place on yelp.. It  had quite a few reviews so I thought we'd give it a try on this sunny Sunday morn. Trying to avoid large crowds and literally this was the perfect spot! This place couldn't have been any smaller.. Worry none about the size. This food is big on taste. Everything was made fresh the OJ was soo sweet, my husband said it was the best coffee he'd ever had.. I had the Challah French Toast I asked for a side of peanut butter and it came with fresh strawberries.  Needless to say I over raved and halfway through my meal hubby and I switched plates.. so I got to enjoy the sausage omlet as well.  I hope the owners of this place expand soon because the only problem I can see is not having proper accommodations to host the patrons.   The wait staff was amazing and if I lived in Scottsdale I'd be here every weekend. I'd recommend this quaint little place for sure:) Yummy for the tummy..

This neighborhood cafe lives up to it's reputation. I think we've found our new weekend breakfast spot! The coffee is good, the food is great,  and the cozy feel and personal touch make you want to be a regular. We will be working our way through the menu, for sure. So far, the crepes are light and delicious, the Mexican iced coffee is refreshing, and my husband was pleasantly surprised with the flavor of the prosciutto in the California Benedict. Definitely worth waiting for a table if necessary...even an outside table!

Consistency eludes this place.  First two trips were pretty good.  My third and final trip was so awful I will never return.  When you walk in you don't know whether to order at the front, seat yourself, wait to be seated?  The tarragon biscuits are awesome except some are awesome and some are crackers.  My partner had a creamy beautiful hollandaise and mine was a clumpy coagulated mess.  Emailed the owner...nothing.  Good luck with the catering business.

Came here for brunch when I was visiting my son and from the looks of it outside I was not expecting much. What a pleasant surprise!  This is a jewel of a breakfast/brunch spot. The eggs are great, served with potatoes, and my son told me the coffee was really good. There are fresh pastries and yogurt parfait made with thick, Greek-style, creamy yogurt. Will definitely come back on my next trip!

Not quite the experience I had the first time... A little disappointed  by...well pretty much everything. Ordered my food no problem, friendly staff as usual. Ordered the regular eggs Benedict, my all time favorite breakfast, everywhere I go, if this is on the menu, let me have it! It came with potatoes I ordered extra crispy. Also asked for water. Sat down and waited for my water and it never came until I asked again for it 15 minutes later. My food came out about 20 minutes from ordering, not bad at all. First thing I noticed was one of my poached eggs were already broke, that's a big no no... Second egg was over cooked, the yolk was solid. Then the potatoes were not crispy at all. Not really what I was expecting from a place called Benedicts that I would usually highly recommend. I sat by the register, small table in the corner and not once was I asked how my food was, but I left well fed! The value is just not there for me. They imply a tip when you pay instead of after your meal. I would not have tipped at all... No service, why tip? Oh wait, I already did! Good luck Benedicts, you look like your doing really well, but I don't think I'll be coming back.

ATTENTION: they are no longer open for breakfast/brunch. They do serve pastries and coffee, but no more menu items. The woman who told us this morning was very kind but I am sure she could tell we were very disappointed. The staff was always so kind and welcoming.   I hope the owners reconsiders opening back up their brunch.

I'm a big fan of eggs Benedict so I was really excited to try this new place. Upon arrival I immediately changed my mind. The place is so small you can barely fit, I felt uncomfortable. To me it looks like more of a coffee shop than a breakfast place. You have to order at the counter and pay right ahead. No problem, but not my style. My roommate is vegan and the only vegan option was the walnut oatmeal. They were out of it. So she had to order 2 roasted potatoes instead. Coffee was good, but you have to get it yourself at the coffee station. My California Benedict looked amazing and it was also fairly tasty. But the bread was too tough, I spent more time trying to cut the bread rather than enjoying it. Will I come back? No. Also cause it's a bit overpriced: $30 dollars for one Benedict, 2 roasted potatoes and 2 coffees I think you guys should represent yourself as a coffee shop rather than "breakfast and brunch". Yelp led me wrong on this one.

This is one of those hidden gems that you try when you're in the area.  The restaurant is a very small store in a little strip mall.  There are maybe 5 tables inside and out making it very limited in space.  Don't being a crowd or you might be standing!  Once you walk in, however, you are greeted with wonderful smells from the bakery and a smiling owner.  The breakfast food is wonderful and I highly suggest going on the weekend and trying their eggs benedict and berry crepes.  Their benedict has homemade tarragon biscuits on the bottom which I love.  The crepes have a very light not too sweet cream and a wonderful berry topping that is refreshing and not overly filling.  We also brought home some scrumptious macaroons and scones that are worth a second visit as well!  In essence, wonderful neighborhood joint worthy of a stop!

I really wish this was open during the week, their breakfast is AMAZING. I find myself craving this all week long, and then the weekend comes and I'm beyond excited to stuff my face with their local ingredients.   It's a little shop tucked away, you have to keep your eye out for it. They do catering during the week, I've actually had some of their stuff that was catered at an event once. && I could tell it was them that had done the catering. It's little details that they focus on.   I've never met the owner, but the place is run by her best friend. And if you meet her she takes really good care and is super passionate about this pride and joy.   The food, oh the food.... Is just so good! Probably my favorite place in Scottsdale to grab food. We always get different stuff, but it never disappoints so I don't really have a favorite because it's all so good. That just goes to show that this place is awesome. I rate it an A+

Loving this place. The best Island Curry chicken Sandwich I have ever had, and did I mention the amazing lattes. They only have three flavors, vanilla bean, caramel and Belgium chocolate but they are all homemade in store and for fantastic. I cannot wait to try the crepes I have heard so many good things about them!

Overpriced, small portions,  and worst of all, poorly made Benedicts. This summarizes the experience I had here with my girlfriend on a Saturday morning.   We ordered a Florentine Benny ($11) and a California Benny ($14). Service was average and it took about 15 min for the food to arrive. That's when things went South. All 4 eggs in our dishes were overcooked to the point of being nearly hard boiled. The hollandaise on top had also begun to break with the oil forming a separate layer on top. Adding insult to injury, the eggs and portions were incredibly tiny - there was literally a single thin slice of prosciutto under each egg in the California Benedict.   Normally I don't go out of my way to write negative reviews, but to be overcharged for a small, poorly executed attempt at an Eggs Benedict in a restaurant named after the dish is beyond disappointing.
This place has a delicious breakfast. I tried the bread pudding waffle and it was one of the best waffles I've ever had in my life. The staff was very nice and friendly.
Good food. Cute place. The potatoes were 'slightly' undercooked but still good. The grape jelly was delicious.  I want to try their Chicken Salad sandwich so I will for sure go back and try that.

This tiny place has a very "classy" feel inside. The music is very relaxing. I recommend calling first to see how busy it is. This place is very small and i think it could get crowded sometimes.  It smells like breakfast on a holiday morning. Service is very good and very friendly. The menu looks awesome. It is a little pricey but this isn't a McDonald's. Everything is mostly under 10 dollars. The french toast is killer. You get two huge pieces of bread with ripe fresh strawberries on them and powder sugar. I gave four stars because my brother got a burrito and said it was just "ehh". I recommend it though!
